[b]Virelyan[/b]
[b]From Sea and Spell Was Virelya Born[/b]

In the forgotten cycles of the Aether, Virelya rose from rift and tide a world not forged of stone, but of essence. Here, the [b]leylines sing[/b] beneath the ocean floor.
The [b]stars mark rituals[/b] in blood and blossom.
Old gods whisper through [b]obsidian obelisks[/b], and the tides carry [b]forgotten grimoires[/b].This world is no stranger to magic it is [b]magic made manifest[/b].

Magic in Virelya is not a tool, but a [b]force of nature[/b]. It flows in [b]leylines[/b], pools in [b]nodes[/b], and weaves through all life.  The world [b]breathes mana[/b], and in turn, [b]mana shapes fate[/b].
Virelya arcane systems are [b]interwoven[/b].

Thaumaturges unravel the secrets of [b]aspects[/b] and [b]aura nodes[/b].  
Botanists channel life through [b]flowers and mana bursts[/b].  
Witchery binds [b]curse and boon[/b] to [b]circle and poppet[/b].  
Blood mages trade [b]vital essence[/b] for [b]power and pain[/b].  
And in silent corners, [b]Ars Magica sigils[/b] shimmer with forgotten tongues.
[b]Spiritual Realms / Collapse[/b]

The spiritual realms of Virelya are fractured echoesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½planes stitched between magic and memory.

Long ago, [b]magical orders[/b] ruled these realms: skyborne Thaumaturges, blood-steeped Cults, and grovebound Seers. But power waned.

[b]Leylines thinned[/b]. [b]Obelisks cracked[/b]. The tides of mana receded, and [b]rifts began to close[/b].

Whispers speak of a [b]Cataclysm of Sigils[/b], when forbidden rites shattered the balance between realspace sparking [b]incursions[/b], [b]spiritual bleed[/b], and arcane fallout.

Now, [b]only ruins remain[/b] of these once-great sects. Spirit-bound libraries drift in void. Shrines flicker out like dying stars.

Yet some say the [b]planes can be healed[/b]. That new bonds of mana, blood, and vis might [b]rekindle the collapse[/b].
[b]Virelya: Timeline Hub[/b]

[b]Welcome, reader.[/b]
This page serves as your anchor in time index of turning points in Virelya mystical history.

Use the links below to jump to specific eras and scroll through their unfolding stories.
[b]Genesis[/b]
[b]  Age Of Strangers[/b]

[b][u]Year 0 Aetheric Shattering[/u][/b]

The Overvoid ruptured, and from the fracture poured raw essence: flame, flow, form the triune roots of mana.

Leylines coiled like veins through dead rock, awakening the seas with pulse and purpose.

No mortal walked then. Only silence, storm, and the First Shapes beings too vast to name, who seeded the disciplines now called magic.

[b]Thaumaturgy[/b] traced the threads of knowledge.  
[b]Bloodcraft[/b] learned to shape will with sacrifice.
[b]Botany[/b] bloomed with encoded life.  
[b]Witchery[/b] echoed pact and pull, the old ways made flesh.  
 
  The world did not begin. It ignited.

[b][u]Year 214 Rise of the Cults[/u][/b]

As the first arcanists cracked the veil, hunger followed.

Across the Virelyan coasts and sky-cracked archipelagos, mortal minds bent toward power not meant to be ownedonly witnessed.

The [b]Crimson Covenant[/b] was the first. Born in secrecy beneath a bleeding moon, it ritualized sacrifice, binding soul and stone with glyph and flesh.

Others followed.  
Some revered decay, feeding rot to conjure growth.  
Some drank voidlight from glass flasks.  
Some raised altars not to gods, but to [i]truths[/i] older than gods.

The world tilted. The first mana storms howled.

[b]Magic was no longer study. It was religion.[/b]

[b][u]Year 613 The Binding War[/u][/b]

It began with a glyph.

One rune to steady a leyline. Another to still a storm. By the hundredth, the world cracked.

The binding circles rose from theory to ideology half salvation, half hubris.
They promised control. What they delivered was fracture.

Sects emerged: one to bind, one to break.
Wards were cast. Towers fell.
Forests ignited not from fire, but from paradox.

The skies bled ink.
The seas forgot their depth.
Rituals lasted days and cost centuries.

No side claimed victory.
Only silence.

[b]  The bindings remain.[/b]
    Dormant. Humming. Waiting

[b][u]Year 871 The Founding Accord[/u][/b]

In the still-smoldering silence after the Binding War, a desperate ceasefire was forged.
Not from peace but from exhaustion.

Scattered cabals, rogue scholars, and what few leyward settlements remained convened at the [i]Mirrored Spire[/i], a neutral pillar of broken skyglass.

They brokered the [b]Founding Accord[/b], a pact of boundaries, trade, and tolerated secrets.
It did not unite them.
But it [i]contained[/i] them.

Each domain walled its philosophies behind glyph-bound borders.
Arcane brewers distilled memory.
Bio-alchemists cultivated the swarm.
Bloodwrights faded into subterranean rites.
Thaumaturges rebuilt old towers, codifying the veil in research, not worship.

It was not peace but it was [b]the worlds first breath in centuries[/b].

[b][u]Year 1024 The Archive Split[/u][/b]

For a time, the world studied rather than bled.

The [b]Great Archive[/b], built atop ancient obsidian roots, housed all known arcane disciplines from alchemical rites to aura-weaving, void harmonics to floral augmentation.

But unity never held.

Philosophers warred with practitioners.
Technomages rejected ancestral rites.
Ritualists scorned the quantifiers.
Each accused the others of diluting [i]truth[/i]  or twisting it.

One stormless dusk, the Archive fractured.
Not from war, but from [b]willful divergence[/b].

Scrolls were redacted.
Sigils disbarred.
Entire wings sealed behind self-immolating glyphlocks.

From this sundering came the [b]Four Paths[/b] not factions, but lenses:
[i]The Rationalists[/i] sought to decode the weave.
[i]The Animists[/i] to bond with it.
[i]The Invokers[/i] to wield.
[i]The Vessels[/i] to become.

Each path now walked alone yet none had stepped away from the edge.

[b][u]Year 1178 The Quiet Era[/u][/b]

Silence fell not peace.

Across the fractured world, towers dimmed.
Altars cooled.
Even the storms withdrew, as if watching.

The arcane surge that had once saturated land, sea, and sky began to thin.

[b]Mana wells ran dry.[/b]
[i]Essentia[/i] lost flavor.
Rituals failed mid-chant.
Wards unraveled without cause.

Many believed it was balance returning.
Others whispered darker truths:
That the world had not healed it was [i]holding its breath[/i].

In this stillness, settlements turned inward.
Scribes copied old glyphs with trembling hands.
Healers lit candles to memory.
And wanderers began seeking the [b]first runes[/b] relics older than any Archive, etched into stone before language.

For nearly two centuries, nothing truly changed.

     But silence is never empty.

[b][u]Year 1402 The Age of Incursion Begins[/u][/b]

No comet heralded it.
No prophecy foretold it.
Only the stars began to tremble.

Leylines warped beneath once-settled ground.
Blood runes, long inert, pulsed without touch.
And deep beneath the basalt cliffs of the Western Reach, [i]something[/i] began to sing.

The world silence shattered.

[b]Mana storms returned,[/b] but now with memory striking only where old spells had once lived.
[i]Spiritual realms[/i] thinned their veil, letting echoes through: dreams that werent your own.
Graves churned. Forgotten tomes wrote themselves anew.

Those who remembered the past began preparing.
Those born after it had no choice but to awaken.

Because the final tab in the Thaumonomicon no longer flickered.
It opened.

[b]The Incursion is not coming.[/b]
It has already begun.

[b][u]Year 1402 ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ The Severance[/u][/b]
The [b]Seal of Crownlight[/b] shattered at dusk.
A thrum echoed across Virelya ley lines a pulse that woke things long thought buried.

In an instant, the great stabilizing anchors obelisks, wards, pacts, soulforges [i]failed[/i].
The sky fractured in veins of mana.
The seas surged upward, as if trying to drown the stars.
Floating sanctums crashed into the forests below.
Forbidden realms bled into the waking world.

This was not war.
This was [b]unbinding[/b].

Now, every island, coast, and cursed shrine is a relic of what came before unclaimed, unstable, and dripping with arcane residue.

[b]In the wake of the Severance:[/b]
Ancient orders fell silent.
Old powers vanished or scattered.
Unbound magics surged
untamed, hungry, free.
[b][u]The Age of Strangers[/u][/b]

No kings. No councils. No gods in sight.

Only mercenaries, outlanders, and those brave enough to trace the old lines.
Some come seeking ley-gold.
Some come to rebuild.
Some come [i]to burn left[/i].

This is where you awaken.
This is the Virelyan Sea as it stands now  a [b]fractured world on the edge of rebirth or ruin[/b].

Choose your path. Bind your name.
And [i]step into the Severed Age[/i].
